content: quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: i dont know i though it was funny... not only did mrs o grab the queen but she shook her hand with both hands... she probity should of spent more time getting to know the customs then she did... my mom said she showed no class... That's a hoot. It seems that the Queen is quite pleased with Michelle Obama and very sincerely invited her to keep in touch. The British citizens were impressed, too. Oh, and Michelle Obama hardly "grabbed" the Queen. The Queen put her hand on Michelle's back FIRST, and Michelle reciprocated. From all reports, they hit it off amazingly well. Oh, and SignalSgtWilliams, when was the last time that you talked to some "common Brit" on the street? Or any British citizen? Any Londoners? By and large, they LIKE the Obamas, and thought it was wonderful to see their Queen acting a bit more warmly than usual.
quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: i dont know i though it was funny... not only did mrs o grab the queen but she shook her hand with both hands... she probity should of spent more time getting to know the customs then she did... my mom said she showed no class...

Oh, and Michelle Obama hardly "grabbed" the Queen. The Queen put her hand on Michelle's back FIRST, and Michelle reciprocated. From all reports, they hit it off amazingly well. Oh, and SignalSgtWilliams, when was the last time that you talked to some "common Brit" on the street? Or any British citizen? Any Londoners? By and large, they LIKE the Obamas, and thought it was wonderful to see their Queen acting a bit more warmly than usual.

content: I think the President comported himself well for a first trip as our leader. But, I think I'll hold off on the kudos until I see what actually happens. The Europeans have a long history of liking American leaders, but considering them moralizing neophytes and working behind the scenes to manipulate him. And, I watched Obama's speech today and am not sure the Europeans will much take to being lectured.
reply: I think the President comported himself well for a first trip as our leader. But, I think I'll hold off on the kudos until I see what actually happens. The Europeans have a long history of liking American leaders, but considering them moralizing neophytes and working behind the scenes to manipulate him. And, I watched Obama's speech today and am not sure the Europeans will much take to being lectured.

content: I think the President comported himself well for a first trip as our leader. But, I think I'll hold off on the kudos until I see what actually happens. The Europeans have a long history of liking American leaders, but considering them moralizing neophytes and working behind the scenes to manipulate him. And, I watched Obama's speech today and am not sure the Europeans will much take to being lectured.

content: quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: i dont know i though it was funny... not only did mrs o grab the queen but she shook her hand with both hands... she probity should of spent more time getting to know the customs then she did... my mom said she showed no class... That's a hoot. It seems that the Queen is quite pleased with Michelle Obama and very sincerely invited her to keep in touch. The British citizens were impressed, too. Oh, and Michelle Obama hardly "grabbed" the Queen. The Queen put her hand on Michelle's back FIRST, and Michelle reciprocated. From all reports, they hit it off amazingly well. Oh, and SignalSgtWilliams, when was the last time that you talked to some "common Brit" on the street? Or any British citizen? Any Londoners? By and large, they LIKE the Obamas, and thought it was wonderful to see their Queen acting a bit more warmly than usual.

content: I think the President comported himself well for a first trip as our leader. But, I think I'll hold off on the kudos until I see what actually happens. The Europeans have a long history of liking American leaders, but considering them moralizing neophytes and working behind the scenes to manipulate him. And, I watched Obama's speech today and am not sure the Europeans will much take to being lectured.
